1.3.20  12:17 pm   Do you think that it's good to take some more responsibilities in your job if you are not self-employed? I have been working at this job for nearly 4 months and management is considering promoting me to chief position. I'm not in STEM field. And this job is tiring as is and i can't even imagine dealing with a lot more work load on top of that. What i'll get in return (money) won't be worth it i think (it's not much of a difference than what i get now). What do you think? What should i do? Should i say no to their proposal?

     i guess it really depends if you have something else lined up, or perhaps just a heaping spoonful of courage

1.3.20  11:05 am   What do you think of the current US political climate and it's us vs them though processes 

     it's fun, it's kind of like watching basketball. very clear who's on which team. no one is allowed to be in the middle, not even the ref, who has already been sent to jail a few times, that's why he wears the jail outfit

1.3.20  10:47 am   what is your favorite planet?

     the splashy one

1.3.20  10:47 am   do you record the voiceover of your videos before making the visuals or the other way around?

     for non-songs, it is temp vocal with accurate timing and delivery. then the video is mostly made to that. then when the video is mostly final, i can go and do the real nice version of the vocal, and also score. for songs, i tend to finish the entire audio absolutely finalized before the video is even started

1.3.20  9:50 am   What's the strange thing you did that turned everything pink?

     probably a weird song ending

1.3.20  9:14 am   Why do we feel pain?

     to encourage you to avoid damage

1.3.20  7:33 am   fictional character you really like? 

     lovely rita

1.3.20  6:50 am   Im dying inside, any advice?

     you are more alive than anyone could ever imagine

1.3.20  6:14 am   so for the longest time i've been stuck voicing chords like a baby on piano. meaning like if there were a Cmaj7 on a leadsheet i would instinctively play it like (C,E,G,B)

     ah yes, it is definitely fun to realize that way of thinking is mostly a myth

      in the left hand AND (C,E,G,B) in the right hand.

     holy cow it's worse than i thought

      It seems kind of dumb but my entire understanding of music and how i made sense of harmony came from root voicing block chords. But it's a serious rut. because obviously listening to your music there's a whole other thing to it which i interpret as "sparse-ness". Meaning EVERY note can MATTER and hold serious weight leading into wherever it goes. I just suppose this anyway...But for Years i couldn't begin to understand the logic to it. Meanwhile, I plowed through a harmony book. learned about all these cool chords Outside of the major scale that relate to the major scale. and implement them as well as fun time signatures into my work in a way that was organic and good. but i still do the dumb chord thing. and so like a year ago to h opefully evolve and understand why I needed to change I started transcribing pop songs i enjoyed, completely. even maracas for like one upbeat on a single measure. So I think my ear is getting better because of that. i mean it might be ridiculous. considering i'm sure even the players for "running on empty"-jackson browne were looking at Much simpler charts than what they actually played. but i insist on doing it. Anyway! So all this time passes in my development and i still feel like i'd immediately fall face first if i were let out in the real world because of the chord thing.

     yeah but it doesn't take long to get up. you'd be surprised how quickly, once you get out there

      throughout all this time i would ask people "how do i get out of this habit, how do i change?" and they said almost every time "...just do it? there's literally nothing stopping you." which seemed kind of asshole-ish. cuz it didn't really seem like advice. but lo and behold, last night i just "did it" and i can't explain how i "did it". i just did. the comping/voice leading was beautiful. it was honestly jus t a deci sion to do it.

     actually for that issue, at least the one you first mentioned, i definitely have some tangible hints, althought it seems like you've already been through it, based on your experience with song books, etc

      and it kind of pisses me off because i could've done this THE WHOLE TIME!! but i literally can't explain it. it's ethereal. something fundamental in ME must've changed, or something. have you ever experienced anything like this?

     yes

      not even just music but like being in a situation where "there's a thing you want to do, you know what it is you gotta do, but something peculiarly vague in your bones is holding you back"? 

     there are many things like that, sort of on the periphery. meanwhile there are the things that are front and center which are usually the subject of a flaming freight train. typically the biggest thing that holds me back on the most important stuff is the vastly infinite quantities of configurations, iterations, permutations, transliterative concatenations, .,.,.,,.,,.,

1.3.20  5:18 am   Do you like mushrooms? I think they taste like raspberries and tears.

     i think they taste like rubber. unless it's the other kind which tastes like forever

1.3.20  2:12 am   1.2.20  3:17 pm

I think it was on one of the cheetah boards, you knew how to do UV mapping with still/static textures onto a 3d model, but you were asking if it was possible with a video instead of a still texture

     oh right. cheetah couldn't quite do that, although there were rumors of someone who scripted a way to do it. i eventually did get it to work, but that was right before moving on to bigger and better things. by the way, cheetah actually couldn't even do audio. (!!!) i just literally did math the whole time, counting frames to manually sync it, as if that was an ok use of my time

     that may sound like a good idea, but with time stopped i think you will find it very difficult to do anything

1.3.20  1:04 am   What do you do when you fear something?

     ask what the thing i fear fears

1.3.20  12:36 am   new year's day feels so great and motivating and like a refresh that i have been desperately craving for months. how do i achieve that start over/clean slate/kick in the ass/time to start doing things feeling without having to wait all those months?

     this might not be what you want to hear, but i always achieve the best results when i do it at my own original time, not jan 1. jan 1st seems jinxed for failure. honestly have you ever met anyone who was still doing their new years resolution in august

     how about some rEnOvAtiONs

1.2.20  11:11 pm   but why is the thing the way that it likes to be

     mostly due to preferential opinion and reasons

1.2.20  11:02 pm   Right now in Australia we're dealing with our worst fires in recorded history and have lost almost 500 million animals and quite a few people, including volunteer firefighters. Over 14 million acres have been burnt. That's twice the size of Belgium. It's scary and hard to comprehend.
I'm lucky enough not to be affected but I feel dreadful not being able to help. I've managed to donate $130 dollars but it feels like nothing. It wouldnt even scratch the surface. It might put fuel in 2 cars with small tanks. It can't buy even a cheap firefighting pump, or hardly any livestock feed, or other necessities like that. It brings me to tears knowing I'm capable of so little because of my lack of money. Sometimes I wish I were rich, purely for the ability to fucking help more and make an actual difference.
Sorry, I just had to vent a bit. I can't express these feelings to people around me because ffs, these selfish issues are nothing compared with w hat the people affected are dealing with and it's childish of me to think like this. Wtf can I do? I'm just one person. 

     what we might need even more than money, is inventiveness. in that sense, you have all the wealth it takes to make potentially the most valuable contribution ever made. all the money in the world is useless without ideas
